review: We like our Apple TV. We have a Samsung Smart TV too but we prefer Apple's clean, clutter-free interface. It is quick and intuitive and the remote is the perfect size when you already have a clunky TV remote taking up table space.It loses a star for its non-customizability. You can't move any of the apps around or add/remove the ones you use the most. Something I didn't realize when we purchased it... The Apple TV 3 is not jailbreakable. If that matters to you, buy the 2 instead.

review: Advertising for the AppleTV states that you can mirror the monitor of a Mac (say a laptop) so long as you have OS X 10.8 (Mountain Lion). The fine print is that you need to be running a laptop from 2010-2011 or newer. If you have older hardware, even if you are running OS X 10.8, you are out of luck. It is interesting (if not, telling) that Amazon's product description for the AppleTV only describes iOS mirroring. To me, that seems like a subtle warning that Apple does not strongly promote the use of AppleTV for mirroring a Mac's display.
